Senior Congress leader Digvijay Singh on Saturday termed as “unfortunate” the alleged attempts to “glorify” Nathuram Godse when the world was following the path of non-violence shown by Mahatma Gandhi.

“The whole world is following the path of non-violence shown by Mahatma Gandhi. But there is a section of people in the country who are trying to glorify his assassin, Nathuram Godse, which is unfortunate,” he said at an event. “These people are trying to disturb the communal harmony, the foundation of which was laid by Gandhiji and Jawaharlal Nehru,” he said at an event here. — PTI
title: Digvijay decries attempt to glorify Mahatma assassin
